channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Top Republicans line up behind Trump after peaceful protesters teargassed for his photo op
Biden delivers blistering condemnation of Trump: 'I won't traffic in fear and division'
The Pentagon simply can't go to war with its own citizens. When will the generals speak out?
item.description: Not since one of President Donald Trump's heroes, Gen. Douglas MacArthur, led a mounted charge in 1932 to disperse an encampment of homeless veterans just outside the White House has the country seen such an application of violence against unarmed protesters outside "the People's House." On Monday evening police, with National Guard troops in reserve, attacked peaceful protesters gathered outside the White House with rubber bullets and tear gas. It's the kind of scene we associate with dictatorships, not western democracies.

item.title: Bishop: Let me be clear, Trump did not come here to pray
item.description: Bishop Mariann Edgar Budde of the Episcopal Diocese of Washington criticized the manner of President Donald Trump's visit to St. John's Episcopal Church amid protests over the death of George Floyd.

item.title: Trudeau refuses to criticize Trump's threat of military intervention
Police officers are joining protesters for prayers and hugs in several US cities
58 people since 2012 lost consciousness after Minneapolis officers put them in neck restraints
item.description: In the years leading up to George Floyd's death with his neck beneath the knee of a Minneapolis policeman, at least 58 people lost consciousness after the city's officers put them in neck restraints, according to a CNN analysis of use of force data from the police department.

item.title: Derek Chauvin's wife requests to change her last name in divorce filing
item.description: In her filing for divorce from former Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin, Kellie Chauvin requested a last-name change and the titles to both of their homes.

item.title: Zuckerberg tries to explain inaction on Trump posts to outraged staff
item.description: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg sought to ease the outrage from a number of employees on Tuesday over his inaction on incendiary remarks recently posted by President Donald Trump on the platform.

item.title: Police chief to Trump: Please, keep your mouth shut if you can't be constructive
item.description: Houston police chief Art Acevedo responds to President Trump telling governors to "dominate" protesters.

item.title: WHO warns Covid-19 could fuel a rise in harmful antibiotic resistance around the world
Brazil's former president calls for Bolsonaro to be impeached
Attacked while studying in a church, she never came home
item.description: It should have been one of the safest places to seek refuge. Instead, Uwaila Vera Omozuwa was attacked as she studied in church, according to Nigerian police.

item.title: Boris Johnson's Brexit nightmare is back at the worst possible moment
item.description: June 2020 is set to be one of the most important months in Boris Johnson's somewhat tumultuous first year as Prime Minister.

item.title: Scientists say they have found the cleanest air on earth
item.description: Scientists believe they have identified the world's cleanest air, free from particles caused by human activity, located over the Southern Ocean, which surrounds Antarctica.

item.title: 11-year-old skateboarder hospitalized after horrific fall
item.description: British skateboarder Sky Brown says her "helmet and arm saved her life" after being involved in a horrific fall during training.

item.title: Gantz tells Israeli Army to step up preparations in West Bank ahead of possible annexation
item.description: Israel's Defense Minister Benny Gantz has told the army to step up preparations in parts of the West Bank, heightening the sense the government stands ready to make a possible dramatic announcement on annexation in the next few weeks.

item.title: Anderson Cooper calls out Trump: 'Who's the thug here?'
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper reacts to President Trump's recent threats to mobilize the US military to end riots over George Floyd's death and his subsequent photo opportunituy at St. John's Episcopal Church.

item.title: Australia will investigate attack on journalists by police in Washington
item.description: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison has called for an investigation after two of the country's journalists were attacked by police in Washington DC on Monday.

item.title: How Atlanta's mayor became the face and voice of her party amid protest and chaos
item.description: Keisha Lance Bottoms wasn't one of the 28 Democratic candidates who ran for the presidential nomination this year. But in the last week, she has become the party's most important voice.

item.title: Jay-Z takes out full-page ads across the country in dedication to George Floyd
item.description: Jay-Z has partnered with families who have lost sons to police violence, along with fellow activists and attorneys, to take out full-page ads in newspapers across the country to honor George Floyd.

item.title: White supremacists pose as Antifa online, call for violence
item.description: A Twitter account that tweeted a call to violence and claimed to be representing the position of "Antifa" was in fact created by a known white supremacist group, Twitter said Monday. The company removed the account.

item.title: Why posting a black image with the Black Lives Matter hashtag does more harm than good
item.description: It's Blackout Tuesday, a day promoted by activists to observe, mourn and bring about policy change in the wake of the death of George Floyd. This movement has spread on social media, where organizations, brands and individuals are posting solemn messages featuring stark black backgrounds, sometimes tagging the posts with #BlackLivesMatter.

item.title: 3 generations share their truth about being black in America
Bernie Sanders tries on a new role in 2020: Inside player
item.description: The episode repeated itself like clockwork during the Democratic primary: Bernie Sanders' staff, and sometimes the candidate himself, would telegraph -- often in the lead-up to a debate night -- a hot new round of attacks on former Vice President Joe Biden.

item.title: India is using drones and fire trucks to fight its worst locust invasion in almost 30 years
item.description: As India continues its battle with the coronavirus pandemic a new kind of invasion is threatening to destroy vital crops and vegetation -- the worst locust swarm the country has seen in almost 30 years.

item.title: Cristobal becomes the earliest third Atlantic named storm on record
item.description: The 2020 hurricane season is only two days old and is already an active one. Cristobal is now the third named storm of the season. It's the earliest a third named storm has ever formed.

item.title: Can this airplane seat keep you safe from Covid-19?
item.description: As conversations continue about if, when and how it's safe to be flying, airplane seat designers continue to sketch out concepts for what the future of aviation might look like.

item.title: Emirates restarts flights but the flying experience won't be the same
item.description: Emirates restarted regular passenger flights with very new measures in place. CNN's John Defterios speaks to the passengers and the crew adjusting to this new normal in air travel.

item.title: 'Rioting is the voices of people who have no voice,' says Kareem Abdul-Jabbar
item.description: As US President Donald Trump vowed to return order to America's streets using the military if widespread violence isn't quelled, one NBA Hall of Fame player says that the rioting that is taking place all across the country is "the voices of people who have no voice."

item.title: Cuomo reacts to Trump holding Bible for photo-op: Open it!
item.description: CNN's Chris Cuomo says President Donald Trump doesn't acknowledge that the nation is in pain because Trump is only looking out for himself.

item.title: Animal DNA is helping unlock some Dead Sea Scrolls secrets
item.description: The Dead Sea Scrolls are like an ancient puzzle that researchers and scholars are trying to piece together, but multiple obstacles block the way. Now, a new study has suggested a potential aid in finding the way these puzzle pieces fit together: animal DNA from the skins used to make the scrolls.

item.title: Carole Baskin awarded the zoo once owned by 'Tiger King' Joe Exotic
item.description: Carole Baskin, whose longstanding feud with Joe Exotic was chronicled in the hit Netflix docuseries "Tiger King," has been awarded the zoo once owned by her nemesis.

item.title: How the world is responding to George Floyd's death
item.description: From Auckland, New Zealand to Rio de Janeiro, Brazil to Berlin, Germany, protesters around the world took to the streets to show solidarity with demonstrators in the US over the death of George Floyd while in police custody. CNN's Nic Robertson reports.

item.title: Safety is now the sexiest word in travel
item.description: Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts collaborating with Johns Hopkins Medicine International. Montage International teaming with primary care provider One Medical. For French hospitality company Accor, the partner is insurance firm AXA, and with Hilton, it's Lysol. And then there's the new safety stamp from the World Travel & Tourism Council (WTTC). The list seems to go on and on.

item.title: A midwife, a train driver and a store worker are British Vogue's latest cover stars
item.description: British Vogue readers might be more familiar seeing supermodels or celebrities gracing its front cover, but July's issue will look a little different, featuring key workers helping provide essential services during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Magic Johnson says he still had 'the talk' with his sons about interacting with police
item.description: NBA legend Magic Johnson tells Anderson Cooper that the protests over the death of George Floyd and racial injustice are justified and that he still had to speak to his children about how to behave around police as black men.

item.title: Maldives brings forward reopening date to July
item.description: The Maldives is reopening to visitors, but while anyone with a super yacht or private jet can already head to the Indian Ocean destination, normal travelers will have to wait a few more weeks.

item.title: The homes frozen in time on an abandoned Hong Kong island
item.description: While many visitors to Hong Kong know about the main Hong Kong island, home to many of the financial capital's skyscrapers, the city is actually an archipelago.

item.title: The world lost a football pitch-sized area of tropical forest every six seconds in 2019
item.description: The world lost 3.8 million hectares of tropical primary forest in 2019 -- equivalent to a football pitch every six seconds -- according to a new report published Tuesday.

item.title: Historic plane to transport dog musher home after he was stranded in Alaska
item.description: What to do when you're stranded in Alaska by a global pandemic and are trying to get back home to Norway -- with 24 dogs in tow.

item.title: CNN turns 40: Look back at some memorable stories
item.description: On June 1, 1980, the Cable News Network hit the airwaves for the first time. 40 years later, look back at the most memorable stories CNN has covered around the globe.

item.title: Vintage family pictures inspired this Nigerian photographer's latest work
item.description: For his latest project, Nigerian photographer Oye Diran looked to his old family photos for inspiration. He was especially taken by the elegant clothing his parents used to wear, including his mother in classic Nigerian iro and buba style (a wrapped skirt and tailored top) -- often paired with a gele (headwrap).

item.title: Beyonc calls on fans to demand justice for George Floyd
item.description: Beyonc posted a video to her Instagram calling on her fans to take action in the wake of George Floyd's death and refuse to "normalize the pain." HLN's Melissa Knowles reports.

item.title: Presumptive Democratic nominee pledged to offer a break from 'selfishness and fear' that he said have marked Trump's tenure
item.description: Joe Biden issued a blistering condemnation of President Donald Trump on Tuesday and pledged to offer a break from the "selfishness and fear" that he said have marked Trump's tenure in office and response to protests against racism and police brutality.

item.title: Trump responds to protests with a strongman act
item.description: What protesters say is fueling their anger Watch: Some police march with protesters

item.title: Officers charged after allegedly using excessive force at protest
item.description: Six Atlanta Police officers are being charged with using excessive force during an arrest of two college students at a protest on Saturday night, Fulton County District Attorney Paul Howard announced Tuesday.

item.title: Pentagon concerned over Trump's threat to use troops
item.description: Defense officials tell CNN there was deep and growing discomfort among some in the Pentagon even before President Donald Trump announced Monday that he is ready to deploy the military to enforce order inside the United States.

item.title: Brazil's former president calls for Bolsonaro to be impeached
item.description: Mexico and parts of Brazil reopening -- despite surging Covid-19 cases

item.title: Over 1.8 million coronavirus cases reported in the US
